result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim E Schein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI Cause Injury (Passenger < 16 Yrs) (2+), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.  
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.  
Defendant shall notify all health care providers of addiction history.
Defendant shall notify Probation Agent within 48 hours of any change in prescribed medications.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment or school.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Hearing on December 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Nadya Perez-Reyes from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Atty. Perez-Reyes informs the Court that the Defendant is recently divorced and has taken her maiden name of Schein.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $10,000 signature bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 1:15 p.m.  
Court may address bond at next hearing on it's own motion if Defendant's health improves.
